title: Saving mom and pop businesses is personal for these undergrads
author: Natasha Payés
excerpt:
When shelter-in-place orders went into effect for the City of Berkeley in mid-March, Vicky Lin, BS 22, thought the impact on local businesses would be temporary. But as COVID-19 cases began to rise and the city extended restrictions well into May, Lin watched in sadness as some of her favorite restaurants, shops, and hangouts struggled […]
The post Saving mom and pop businesses is personal for these undergrads appeared first on Haas News | Berkeley Haas.
